text: There was a blizzard in Mid December 2009 in the northeast. The blizzard dumped heavy snow and strong winds. of snow fell on Washington D.C.. ==History== The storm formed on December 16 in Texas with heavy rain. On December 17, the heavy rain moved NE towards the Northeast and by the evening of December 17 it was in North Carolina. On December 18, the rain turned to snow and was in Virginia in the morning, and in Maryland in the evening. By the night of December 18, it was in Delaware. On December 19 it raced across New jersey, and hit NYC. Blizzard warnings and winter storm warnings have been put in action. Then it moved towards Connecticut and Massachusetts. By December 20, the blizzard wasn't from Maine to Canada and then dissipated over sea. ==Impact== ===North Carolina=== North Carolina saw mostly heavy rain from the storm, but some of it saw very heavy snow, near-blizzard and even blizzard conditions. Greensboro saw of snow after heavy rain. ===Virginia=== Virginia saw mainly heavy snow except for the South and the coastline. to of snow fell on Richmond. Washington saw of snow and was the hot spot for the blizzard. ===Maryland=== Maryland saw heavy snow and a blizzard. The blizzard dumped over of snow on Cambridge, and Ocean city, on the immediate coast saw several inches of drenching rain and even thunderstorms. ===Delaware=== Delaware saw heavy snow and a blizzard. The blizzard dumped to of snow on Dover. The immediate coast saw rain. The blizzard made rally a lot of heavy snow and strong winds on Delaware. ===New Jersey=== New Jersey saw a blizzard from the storm. There was heavy snow and strong winds. There were of snow in Camden, and only to in Milford. There was rain in Atlantic City, and Cape May. ===New York City=== New York City saw heavy snow and a blizzard. There were about of snow in NYC. There was some sleet in Bay ridge for a very short moment, and even some light rain === The rest of the Northeast=== The rest of the Northeast saw also heavy snow, and parts saw a blizzard. Connecticut saw from to of snow in the South, to to of snow in the Northwest. Massachusetts also saw from 0.2 to 0.7 inches in the Northwest, to to in the South. Maine and Canada also saw similar amounts with sleet and freezing rain near the immediate coast. == Related pages == * North American blizzard of 2003 * December 2010 North American blizzard * January 31 â€“ February 2, 2011 North American winter storm * February 2013 nor'easter Category:2009 in the United States Category:Historic blizzards in the United States Category:2009 in weather Category:December events
title: December 2009 North American blizzard
